seniority_level.evidence: 3–5+ years of experience mentioned in the requirements, aligned with mid-level data engineering roles. Title is 'Data Engineer' without senior modifiers.

job_family.evidence: Title explicitly states 'Data Engineer', and core responsibilities focus on ETL/ELT, data modeling, and pipelines.

sub_specialty.evidence: Core focus on process mining platforms (e.g., Celonis), PQL, and ERP data extraction (SAP). Kafka and streaming are nice-to-haves but not primary.

leadership_expectation.evidence: Role involves acting as technical owner of the Process Intelligence platform, translating technical realities into business impact, and collaborating with consultants/stakeholders. No direct people management mentioned.

primary_cloud.evidence: No explicit mention of AWS, Azure, GCP, or cloud services in the job posting or Pass 1 extraction.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Mentions both batch (ETL/ELT, data modeling) and streaming (Kafka, event-driven connections as nice-to-haves). No strong emphasis on either paradigm.

orchestrator_category.evidence: No explicit mention of orchestrators like Airflow, Dagster, Prefect, or cloud-native alternatives.

storage_layer.evidence: Mentions major data platforms (Databricks, Snowflake) which are typically used for warehouse and lake patterns. No explicit lakehouse tools (Delta Lake, Iceberg) mentioned.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location specified as Amsterdam, Netherlands, with hybrid/remote flexibility mentioned. Likely implies same region (Europe) for remote work.

timezone_focus.evidence: Location is Amsterdam, Netherlands, and team is described as international but no specific timezone requirements beyond region.

relocation_required.evidence: Hybrid/remote flexibility mentioned, no explicit relocation package or requirement stated.

h1b_friendly.evidence: Pass 1 extraction states 'not_mentioned' for visa sponsorship, and location is outside the US.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of OPT/CPT or student visa support, and location is outside the US.

citizenship_required.evidence: No discussion of citizenship or work authorization requirements in the job posting or Pass 1 extraction.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Employment type is full-time and contract type is permanent, but no explicit mention of W2, C2C, or 1099 in the Netherlands context.

benefits_level.evidence: Benefits mentioned include competitive compensation, development opportunities, hybrid/remote flexibility, and a water-front workplace. No premium benefits like equity or learning budgets explicitly stated.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'development opportunities' and 'grow' in the team description, but no explicit career tracks or promotion ladders.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Describes team as 'international, smart and ambitious' with collaboration emphasis, but no formal mentorship program mentioned.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotions or advancement paths in the job posting or Pass 1 extraction.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No discussion of internal mobility or lateral moves in the job posting or Pass 1 extraction.

career_tracks_available.evidence: Role emphasizes technical ownership and collaboration, suggesting an IC track. No explicit mention of management, specialist, or architect tracks.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear distinction between must-haves (8 skills) and nice-to-haves (6 skills), with balanced language in requirements.

scope_definition.evidence: Job description is focused on data engineering for process intelligence, with well-defined responsibilities and no ambiguity.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Must-haves align with mid-level data engineering roles (3–5+ years), no unrealistic skill combinations detected.
